block.p: Laurie Adlerstein, the daughter of Jo Anne and Lee Adlerstein of West Orange, N.J., and Manhattan, was married on Thursday to Alan Mordechai Novick, a son of Dr. Etta Novick and Dr. Isaac Novick of Woodsburgh, N.Y. Rabbi Michael Rosensweig officiated at Mayfair Farms, a caterer in West Orange.

Mrs. Novick, who graduated cum laude from Yale, and Mr. Novick, a summa cum laude graduate of Princeton, attend the Bernard Revel Graduate School at Yeshiva University, where they met. The bride, 24, is a candidate for a master's degree in Bible studies and is to become a tutor in Talmud and Jewish law next month at Stern College for Women of Yeshiva. The bridegroom, 25, is known as Moti. He is a candidate for a master's in medieval Jewish history and a rabbinical student at the Rabbi Isaac Elchanan Theological Seminary at Yeshiva.

The bride's father is an assistant New York State attorney general in Manhattan and the vice chairman of the Jewish Council for Public Affairs. Her mother works in Newark as the head of the immigration law practice for Proskauer Rose, the New York law firm.
The bridegroom's parents, both dermatologists, practice together in Brooklyn. His father is also president of the school board of the Hebrew Academy of Five Towns and Rockaway in Lawrence, N.Y.
